questions.text: Which of the following does not act as a secondary messenger in drug action pathways?
Loading dose of a drug depends on:
Which of the following pharmacokinetic values most reliably reflects the total bioavailability of a drug reaching the target tissue after oral administration?

options.label: C
options.text: Product of the Vd and the first-order rate constant

options.label: D
options.text: Area under the blood concentration –time curve (AUC)

questions.correct_answer: D. Area under the blood concentration –time curve (AUC)

questions.text: A child who is born to a mother, who has history of carbimazole intake during first trimester of pregnancy, can have all of the following presentations except:
questions.correct_answer: B. Cleft lip and cleft palate

questions.text: Good Clinical Practices (GCPs) guidelines which are followed during drug discovery is not a part of:

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Oral FQs should be taken 2 hours before or 4 hours after calcium or iron tablets

options.label: C

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: C. Moxifloxacin is one of the front line drug for pyelonephritis

questions.text: All of the following drugs can induce liver CYP3A4 enzymes except :

questions.correct_answer: C. ID injection produces local tissue necrosis and irritation

questions.text: In hypoalbuminemia, the dosage of all drugs should be decreased except
Regarding efficacy and potency of a drug, all are true, except:

options.label: A
options.text: In a clinical setup, efficacy is more important than potency

options.label: B
options.text: In the log dose response curve, the height of the curve corresponds with efficacy

options.label: C
options.text: ED50 of the drug corresponds to efficacy

options.label: D
options.text: Drugs that produce a similar pharmacological effect can have different levels of efficacy

questions.correct_answer: C. ED50 of the drug corresponds to efficacy

questions.text: True statement regarding first order kinetics is :

options.label: A
options.text: Plasma concentration of a drug achieved is independent of dose

options.label: B
options.text: Rate of elimination is directly proportional to plasma concentration

questions.correct_answer: B. Rate of elimination is directly proportional to plasma concentration

questions.text: A 3-year-old child is brought to the emergency department having just ingested a large overdose of promethazine, an antihistaminic drug. Promethazine is a weak base with a pKa of 9.1. It is capable of entering most tissues, including the brain. On physical examination, the heart rate is 100/min, blood pressure 110/60 mm' Hg, and respiratory rate 20/min. In this case of promethazine overdose?

options.label: A
options.text: Urinary excretion would be accelerated by administration of NH4Cl, an acidifying agent

options.label: B
options.text: Urinary excretion would be accelerated by giving NaHCO3, an alkalinizing agent

options.label: C
options.text: More of the drug would be ionized at blood pH than at stomach pH

options.label: D
options.text: D. Hemodialysis is the only effective therapy

questions.correct_answer: A. Urinary excretion would be accelerated by administration of NH4Cl, an acidifying agent

questions.text: The results shown in the graph below were obtained in a comparison of positive inotropic agents. Which of the following statements is MOST correct?

options.label: B
options.text: Drug A is more potent than drug B and more effective than drug C

options.label: D
options.text: Drug B is more potent than drug C and more effective than drug A

questions.correct_answer: D. Drug B is more potent than drug C and more effective than drug A

questions.text: Mr. Jones is admitted to General Hospital with pneumonia due to gramnegative bacteria. The antibiotic tobramycin is ordered. The CL and Vd of tobramycin in Mr. Jones are 80 mL/min and 40 L, respectively. What maintenance dose should be administered intravenously every 6 hours to eventually obtain average steady-state plasma concentrations of 4 mg/L?

Verapamil and phenytoin are both eliminated from the body by metabolism in the liver. Verapamil has a clearance of 1.5 L/min, approximately equal to liver blood flow, whereas phenytoin has a clearance of 0.1 L/min. When these compounds are administered along with rifampin, a drug that increases hepatic drug-metabolizing enzymes, which of the following is most likely?

options.label: A
options.text: The clearance of both verapamil and phenytoin will be increased

options.label: B
options.text: The clearance of both verapamil and phenytoin will be decreased

options.label: C
options.text: The clearance of verapamil will be unchanged, whereas the clearance of phenytoin will be increased

options.label: D
options.text: The clearance of phenytoin will be unchanged, whereas the clearance of verapamil will be increased

questions.correct_answer: C. The clearance of verapamil will be unchanged, whereas the clearance of phenytoin will be increased

questions.text: Which of the following is the main mechanism by which the mechlorethamine exerts its anticancer effect?

options.label: A
options.text: Alkylating DNA, causing cross-links between parallel DNA strands

options.label: B
options.text: Blocking microtubular assembly and mitosis during M-phase

options.label: C
options.text: Inhibiting topoisomerase, preventing repair of DNA strand breaks

options.label: D
options.text: Intercalating in DNA strands, there by preventing DNA replication by mRNA

questions.correct_answer: A. Alkylating DNA, causing cross-links between parallel DNA strands

A 2-year-old child is brought to the hospital after ingesting pills that is meant for treatment of bacillary dysentry. Other signs and symptoms include hypothermia, hypotension, and abdominal distention. The drug most likely to be the cause of this problem is
The mechanism of antibacterial action of tetracyclines involves

options.label: A
options.text: Binding to a component of the 50S ribosomal subunit

options.label: C

questions.correct_answer: C. Blockade of binding of aminoacyl-tRNA to bacterial ribosomes

questions.text: A 55-year-old patient with a prosthetic heart valve is to undergo a periodontal procedure involving scaling and root planing. Several years ago, the patient had a severe allergic reaction to procaine penicillin G. Regarding prophylaxis against bacterial endocarditis, which one of the following is most appropriate?

options.label: A
options.text: No prophylaxis is needed since this patient is in the negligible risk category

options.label: B
options.text: Give 600 mg of clindamycin orally 1 hour before the procedure

options.label: C
options.text: Give 500 mg of erythromycin orally 1 hour before the procedure and 4 hours after the procedure

options.label: D
options.text: Administer intravenous vancomycin prior to the procedure

questions.correct_answer: B. Give 600 mg of clindamycin orally 1 hour before the procedure

questions.text: Which one of the following statements about doxycycline is false?

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: D. It is more active than tetracycline against H. pylori

questions.text: Which one of the following statements about the clinical uses of the aminoglycosides is false?

options.label: A
options.text: Aminoglycosides are not absorbed following oral administration

options.label: B
options.text: Gentamicin is used with ampicillin for synergistic effects in the treatment of enterococcal endocarditis

options.label: C
options.text: Netilmycin is more likely to be effective than streptomycin in the treatment of a hospital acquired infection caused by Serratia marcescens

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: D. The spectrum of antimicrobial activity of aminoglycosides includes Bacteroides fragilis

questions.text: Regarding the toxicity of gentamicin, which one of the following statements is most accurate?

options.label: A
options.text: Ototoxicity is reduced if loop diuretics are used to facilitate gentamicin excretion

options.label: B
options.text: Ototoxicity due to gentamicin is usually irreversible and manifests itself as vestibular dysfunction

options.label: C
options.text: Gentamicin is more likely to cause ototoxic effects than renal damage

options.label: D
options.text: With traditional dosage regimens, the earliest sign of nephrotoxicity is a reduced creatinine clearance

questions.correct_answer: B. Ototoxicity due to gentamicin is usually irreversible and manifests itself as vestibular dysfunction

questions.text: A 24-year-old woman has returned from a vacation abroad suffering from traveler's diarrhea and her problem has not responded to antidiarrheal drugs given for non infective causes. In one of the clinical trial, tablet lumefantrine is given to a particular human subject on two different days . On first day it is given empty stomach with water and on second day it is given along with milk. Concentration of drug achieved in plasma on both days are same but on first day it is achieved in 3 hours and on second day it is in 1 hour. According to you , which of the following parameter is best to use to find out this difference in pharmacokinetics :
All cause acute interstitial nephritis except
All of the following cause hypertension except
Phase 1 clinical trial is done to test:
Which of the following drug is IL-4 receptor inhibitor approved for bronchial asthma?
Drug given for pulmonary complications of cystic fibrosis?
Benefits of enteric coated tablets are all except:

options.label: C
options.text: It avoids absorption in stomach so that it can occur distally

questions.text: A 32 year old females, k/c/o depression, comes to you with drug overdose with marked sedation, confusion and delirium. She has history of seizure at home after drug intake. On examination, you have found she is having ventricular arrhythmias, hypotension, and hyperthermia, flushing and dilated pupils. Which of the following drug has no role in treatment of above patient?

A drug inspector has investigated a case of misconduct by a drug manufacturer company and ready to impose penalty under Drugs and cosmetic act ,1940 of India. In his report he has mentioned that drug manufacturer has polished a particular batch of oral tablets with a crimson blue colour in order to conceal the damaged putrified part of drug due to improper storage condition. In his final remarks,he will label this drug batch as a :

A 26 year old non pregnant female known case of primary generalized tonic-clonic seizures since 5 years, well controlled on sodium valproate , wants to conceive and comes to you to take advice for her anti epileptic treatment. Which of the following best advise to her ?

options.label: A
options.text: Continue the same medicine as recurrence rate is high while changing the treatment

options.label: B
options.text: Stop sodium valproate and switch to levitiracetam as it is safe

options.label: C
options.text: Stop sodium valproate gradually and wait for few more months and conceive without taking anti epileptic drug if seizure wont recur

options.label: D
options.text: Its better to postpone the plan to conceive as all anti epileptics have some risk of teratogenesis

questions.correct_answer: C. Stop sodium valproate gradually and wait for few more months and conceive without taking anti epileptic drug if seizure wont recur

questions.text: A 35 year male patient taking sodium valproate for his epileptic disease, now comes to you with severe grade of trigeminal neuralgia and you have decided to add carbamazepine to his treatment schedule. Which of the following side effect incidence can be enhanced due to above drug combination?

A 34 years old male suffering from schizophrenia and controlled on tablet haloperidol 5mg/day since last 5 years, now comes to you with repeated protruding of tongue, lips smacking and retraction of the corners of the mouth. There is also history of abnormal chewing movements of face and shoulder shrugging. Except one all of the following drugs can bring relief to above patient if given or added to the treatment:

A 70 year old parkinsons disease patient suffering from severe disease, refractory to most of anti parkinsonism drug, has been kept on high dose levodopa therapy to improve quality of life. Now this patient is presented in OPD with delusion of spouse infedility and visual hallucinations. Which of the following antipsychotic is best to start to manage the above complication:
A 45 year old alcoholic patient with liver cirrhosis has come to you with psychosis, delusion and hallucination. Which antipsychotic out of following is best to start in treatment of above patient?

A female patient was on lithium therapy for bipolar disorder for 6 months. She kept the fast for few days due to religious reasons and presented with seizures, coarse tremors, confusion and weakness of limbs. Which of the following should be done to diagnose her condition?

A 42 year alcoholic admitted in de addiction centre for treatment and successfully deaddcited with help of psychotherapy as well as pharmacotherapy where combination of naltrexone plus acamprostae was given. At the time of discharge he was advised to take tab disulfiram for few weeks. Why this above decision is made:

A preganant lady suffering from RHD with implanted prosthetic heart valve taking warfarin 10mg/day as prophylactic therapy, what is the best time to switch to heparin therapy?

DOC for 50 year old male suffering from pneumonia comes to you in OPD with no history of any other illness and antibiotic intake in previous three months. There are reports of resistant strains of S. pneumonie in community. Which of the following is best antibiotic to start his treatment?
A patient taking a diuretic for several months presents with significantly elevated serum glucose levels. You suspect it is diuretic induced. Which of the following is the most likely cause?

A 70-year-old woman is admitted to the emergency room because of a "fainting spell" at home. She appears to have suffered no trauma from her fall, but her blood pressure is 110/60 when lying down and 60/40 when she sits up. Neurologic examination and an ECG are within normal limits when she is lying down. Questioning reveals that she has recently started taking diuretics for a heart condition. Which of the following drugs is the most likely cause of her fainting spell?

A 64-yrs-old woman has had several episodes of transient ischemic attacks (TIAs). Aspirin would be a preferred treatment, but she has a history of severe “aspirin sensitivity” manifests as intense bronchoconstriction. What would be a best suitable alternative to the aspirin?

A patient develops severe thrombocytopenia after 10 days of treatment with unfractionated heparin that is started after a surgery for deep vein thrombosis.. What is best management for the complication developed in above patient :

A 67-year-old woman presents with pain in her left thigh muscle. Duplex ultrasonography indicates the presence of deep vein thrombosis (DVT) in the affected limb. The decision was made to treat this woman with enoxaparin. During the next week, the patient was started on warfarin and her heparin was discontinued. Two months later, she returned after a severe nosebleed. Laboratory analysis revealed an INR (international normalized ratio) of 7.0 (INR value in such a Warfarin-treated patient should be 2.5-3.5). What is the best management of above case :

options.label: B
options.text: Stop warfarin for few days and restrart if inr comes in desired range

options.label: C
options.text: Stop warfarin and give vitamin k injection

options.label: D
options.text: Admit the patient and give plasma and vitamin k

questions.correct_answer: D. Admit the patient and give plasma and vitamin k

questions.text: In treatment of filariasis, Three drug combination used as pilot project in few states of India include all of the following drugs except:

A 2l-year-old man was seen in a clinic with a complaint of dysuria and urethral discharge of yellow pus. He had a painless clean-based ulcer on the penis and nontender enlargement of the regional lymph nodes. lmmunofluorescent microscopic examination of fluid expressed from the penile chancre of this patient revealed treponemes. Since he appears to be infected with T pallidum, the best course of action would be to

options.label: A
options.text: Treat with intravenous aqueous penicillin G

options.label: D
options.text: Give a single oral dose of fosfomycin

questions.correct_answer: C. Inject intramuscular benzathine penicillin G

A 42-yrs-old female , is diagnosed with metastatic breast cancer. Why might fulvestrant be the better choice over tamoxifen provided all other factors being equal?

options.label: A
options.text: Exerts antiplatelet, rather than thrombotic, effects

options.label: B
options.text: Lacks ability to cause hot flashes or other disturbing side effects

options.label: C
options.text: Lower risk of causing endometrial cancer

options.label: D
options.text: Provides clinical cure, rather than palliation, in all patients

questions.correct_answer: C. Lower risk of causing endometrial cancer
